title: The Gragas Rework was a failure
body:
Gragas has been sitting at a 40-45% winrate and 2% popularity for the entire month of January.

Riot, face it : you messed up here.  Gragas needs to be addressed again, whether you help his numbers out or address the way his kit works again.

Maybe the Q should not have to sit around charging to deal any meaningful damage. Or maybe the W should not disable his ability to cast E.

He just feels clunky and his damage and waveclear is really lackluster.  Give him a direction or niche or *something* because right now he's just a waste of space.

replies.body: Personally I felt his rework was a success until they put a mana cost on drunken rage. As soon as they did that a mana item became required and he could no longer go tanky AP bruiser, or off-tank bruiser.

> [{quoted}](name=GanksLikeGast0n,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wmlsQEi4,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-01-27T20:16:30.322+0000)
>
> Personally I felt his rework was a success until they put a mana cost on drunken rage. As soon as they did that a mana item became required and he could no longer go tanky AP bruiser, or off-tank bruiser.

I've thought this exactly. 

I liked the rework, and I still do, but it just doesn't really work, and to me, that went into effect when they nerfed the minion damage on the barrels (I think?) and they made Drunken Rage cost mana. 

The glaring problem with Gragas is in the tier list (as much as I hate looking at those). He has the Urgot problem... Where there isn't a single lane he can really do well in and requires a ton of work and skill to be good in the lane.

Ideally, I think every champ should be at least decent in one lane. Gragas is not.

I prefer jungling. Made a post of his issues in this thread if you want to read my opinion on it. It does indeed require a lot of skill and practice to get it to decent lvls but it's a challenge and it's fun. He'd just need a few changes that would also help him in lane.
his kit outside of his W channel time has great synergy in my humble opinion.

mmm, you're right. and perhaps i worded it incorrectly. gragas' kit is probably doing the right things, it's other factors that make him feel unplayable or "clunky" as i like to say.

bringing back his strength in lane would be cool. i've always imagined him as a lane bully with meh scaling but a good teamfight ultimate to make up for that. i dont know about giving him back waveclear, but at least some quality of life changes to the W and Q animations, and maybe remove the charging damage mechanic on his Q (and increasing it from the minimum) would do a lot for him.

I think another thing that killed Gragas was the 70% damage to minions. It takes 3 barrels to kill caster minions early game.

I just want Gragas mid to be viable. They try to keep different playstyles for other champions (ex: ad and ap nidalee), but try to force gragas into one role. Before the rework, Gragas was overpowered in mid lane. After the rework and nerfs (30 mana on w, and 70% damage to minions on Q), he cannot be successfully played mid lane.

I really think they should focus on making him a jungler, but his Q and E feel really lackluster for it 

Do they want him to build tank? Doesn't really have anything in his kit to reward him for that
Do they want him to have good sustain? 50 or so health every 8 seconds isn't really sustain
Do they want him to build AP? His ratios and base aren't exactly that high anymore

I really dislike how his E is this awesome 280 magic damage ability but you are forced to max Q and W before it. Can we get health damage on his E or something? Can it go back to the half reduction instead of 3 second reduction?

Really any of those would be fine, because it would at least give him a direction.  Right now its just a bunch of low damage with some moderately useful CC, but why would anybody pick him over a similar champ like Lissandra who is safer, and deals more damage from a greater range?

I'd love to see him designed as a jungler really.  It's obvious from past examples that as a top laner his design can be a bit oppressive, and as a midlaner he would just be the old gragas (which admittedly didn't make sense).

no, tank gragas is actually great. you go fulltank and a frozen gauntlet. that shit hurts. he has %dmg, tons of slows, aoe knockbacks and so on. everything a jungler needs. did i forget his HUGE playmaking potential with E -FLASH-R the enemy adc into your team? DONT change him.

The rework was fine. But he was overnerfed after that. 

His rework went from him being OP in the mid lane and a decent junglers. To a situational mid lane/support. Good top lane. And still a decent jungler. 
He can currently be played in any roll but ADC. Although this was before the jungle changes. 

I think changing, reverting or working around the nerf to the mana on drunken rage would do him a lot of good.

They need to shorten W channel time... There is no reason to silence yourself for 1 second for something that only works when you autoattack in melee range. If you have some cdr you're invalidated from the fight for a second every 4 seconds or less if you want to optimize your damage (you're effectively CC-ing yourself for 1/3 - 1/4 of a teamfight).
As far as I know you can't even flash during channel time for W (I've died like that a few times).
He also has mana issues, W should not cost any mana, or they need to rework the jungle ap item to give some mana back akin to the old spectral wraith item or put some mana regen on it. (reduce 10% cdr if they do that). The only way to viably play him imo is in the jungle and that is heavily gated by the massive mana consumption to the point where you either take every blue (your mids will dislike you) or you can only farm 2 camps then gank to use all your mana.

And despite butchering his bases and scalings (esp the Q change) he still works best as a full ap burst. The only tanky item that synergises well with him and only works in lane is Rod of Ages. And this is largely only because of the W channel time. You can't viably channel all the time (because it invalidates you for so long) for sustained damage, it's much more convenient to charge it up slam into someone and unleash full burst then back off until your cooldowns are up again. It also touches back on the mana costs: you can't sustain fight because your mana runs out as fast as a burst mage's.

{{champion:79}} has been bae ever since I began playing. Now, when I play him, it just feels kind of underpowering.

Bring my bae back, rito pls.
YES gragas rewark was one of riots biggest failure rewards to date... IMO
I really wish they will revert Gragas to the old one!
Then make a new post about it instead of necroing a 3 year old post. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

I don't think Gragas should ever go back to his old playstyle unless Riot wants to embrace it and give him a Mario or DK skin, because other than the fact he would autoattack melee... he would ONLY roll barrels. In fact, his old Drunken Rage was only really used to honestly regenerate mana... So he could roll more barrels... There was no drunken brawler in his old self... Just... Barrel Roller.

I like the kit, and I agree with Apulminate that he CAN scale well into late game, but the problem is... It requires too much skill than its worth to play him in any position, and even so, the amount of skill it takes to play him well, there are plenty of others that can do it with far less effort, or can outplay it with equal skill.
He should be turned back into a mage. The rework made no sense.

I think the glaring problem with Gragas is Riot now suggests him as a jungler (he's honestly not bad at it either), but they don't have him ironed out well enough to support it as effectively. Overall, has had jungle mage items, but the only mage they've really paid tribute to working in the jungle is Fiddlesticks... At this point, I think Gragas is just there to say "Oh no, there is another mage choice... See, Gragas. Oh, and also that one cloaking lady."

Like I stated earlier, ideally, every champ needs to have one lane they are decent at. Gragas does not. He requires a good bit of skill to play Top, Mid, Supp, and Jng. He doesn't excel at anything, he's barely in the category of Jack of Trades. Because by definition, a Jack of Trades is at least decent at everything, but excels at nothing, he doesn't even have the decent part down. 

TL;DR: Gragas isn't a Jack of Trades, he's more a Jack of Tards.

Subsequent changes have caused him to fall off but honestly, there are many many other champions who haven't seen play in years that need to be buffed to viability before gragas. On top of that, gragas isn't a top pick but he is much closer than many other champions.

He currently has the lowest win rate and is in the bottom 15 least played(indicating a problem). But yes there are other champs  who need looking at more then Graggy right now. I would like to think his VU is comming soon though maybe they will actually give him some attention then.

Gragas' direction is supposed to be a drunken fighter, so a chunky melee AP mage.  You can't exactly run Sunfire Cape first (Garen mains), nor can you build pure AP.  A good direction to go in my opinion is first into Iceborn Gauntlet or Rod of Ages (both in your setup should be grand) and then full tank items to make you an AP bruiser.

They wanted him to build tanky, so they destroyed his ability to clear waves unless he stacks AP.

Logic.

The reason he sucks is because he's supposed to be a lane bully, but he can't bully his lane without building mana. But if you build mana, you sacrifice your power spike and get outscaled quickly.

I'd be fine with Riot ironing out some of the kinks he has, but please, dear god please, do not make him a mage again.

Please.

For example, whenever they announce a visual update for a character. Name three champs that fans constantly bring up that could REALLY could have used the update more.

This is what a ton of people are annoyed about. Going back to the main topic of Gragas. As you can read, not many people are angry about his new kit. There are a ton that are quite happy he is no longer just a barrel roller. It's that there was a lot of work to balance out the new kit, then just "Oookay, well this doesn't work, so we'll leave it be... Oh, right. Let's update Jax."

His waveclear is completely ridiculous still.  And honestly, I believe the only thing that needs to be done is to change the w being able to be charged without locking your out of your e.  The whole point to gragas' dash is to get the knock up, and to close the distance.  So why would you make him have a channeled w if you couldn't use your catch up/stun mechanism to get that auto attack off?  His ult is still completely ridiculous in team fights.

His rework was a succes till they overnerfed him offcourse. He lost everything his new kit stands for:

* Burst on his W
* Sustain from his passive
* Some damage from his Q

Whe just need our lane bully into lategame tank back. He need some tweaks but and I think it has mostly todo with his scaling. An change I really want to see on him:

* Drunken Rage: Buff his base damage values again & let it scale with bonus health.
* Body Slam: Replace the AP scaling with maximum health scaling. He litterly smash his belly against the enemy. Look more to health scaling to me.

That would mean Gragas has:

* Q: AP scaling
* W: Bonus Health & AP scaling
* E: Maximum Health scaling
* R: AP scaling

It would fit his build a lot of better. So will he probaly rush {{item:3136}} for snowballing or take the {{item:3027}} route for slow scaling. Gragas is no longer the mage he ones was. Just increase his potentional as a AP bruiser & let him him scale better from tanky items.

Start with the Magus enchantment. (not sure what base item though) Then you can start prioritizing tank. 

In the past I tried the Juggernaut enchantment. But you really can't sacrifice the clear speed by not going Magus. I would Probably go for a mix of Health and sustain.
